triples.name: Twitter
triples.relevance: Twitter is the social media platform from which the paper collects and analyzes user data.

triples.name: Demography
triples.relevance: The paper proposes novel techniques for demographic analysis of Twitter users compared to the U.S. population.

triples.name: Geography
triples.relevance: Geography is one of the three axes (along with gender and race/ethnicity) used to analyze population distribution.

triples.name: Gender
triples.relevance: Gender is one of the three demographic axes analyzed to compare Twitter and U.S. populations.

triples.name: Ethnicity
triples.relevance: Ethnicity and race are one of the three demographic axes used to assess population representativeness.

triples.name: Sampling (statistics)
triples.relevance: The paper develops techniques for comparing populations using statistical sampling methods on over 1% of U.S. Twitter users.

triples.name: United States Census Bureau
triples.relevance: Census data serves as the reference population for comparing Twitter user demographics to the overall U.S. population.
